sub_topic: Prove that the empty set is a subset of every set.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3, 4} and B = {}. Is the empty set {} a subset of set A?
message_2: Yes, the empty set {} is a subset of set A. By definition, a subset is a set whose elements are all members of another set. The empty set has no elements, so all of its (non-existent) elements are members of set A. In general, the empty set is a subset of any set.
